meanings.definition: An overwhelming feeling of great happiness or joyful excitement.
meanings.sent1: The children were in ecstasy when they saw the colorful balloons at the party.
meanings.sent2: She danced with ecstasy when she found out she got the job.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's ecstasy over the new toy was contagious to everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: His face lit up with ecstasy as he opened the gift from his best friend.
meanings.sent5: The bride's face glowed with ecstasy as she walked down the aisle.

meanings.definition: A state of being beyond reason and self-control.
meanings.sent1: After winning the lottery, he was in such ecstasy that he couldn't think straight.
meanings.sent2: In a moment of ecstasy, she jumped into the pool fully clothed.
meanings.sent3: The cat's ecstasy over the laser pointer led to a hilarious chase around the house.
meanings.sent4: His mind was in a whirlwind of ecstasy as he made the spontaneous decision to travel the world.
meanings.sent5: The crowd erupted in ecstasy when their team scored the winning goal.

meanings.definition: A drug that produces intense feelings of pleasure and euphoria.
meanings.sent1: The dangerous drug caused him to experience a false sense of ecstasy.
meanings.sent2: She became addicted to the drug because of the temporary ecstasy it provided.
meanings.sent3: The movie portrayed a fictional drug that induced extreme ecstasy in its users.
meanings.sent4: The drug dealer promised his customers a taste of pure ecstasy with his latest product.
meanings.sent5: The authorities cracked down on the illegal distribution of ecstasy in the city.
